body.description: This panel is classic in every sense of the word. The Montego Casual Grommet Top Curtain Panel comes in a bevy of colors to choose from so it'll be easy to pick your favorite hue. This curtain panel is contemporary in styling and will look flawless in any décor. For easy care, machine wash in cold and tumble dry. This package includes 1 curtain panel.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About No. 918 No. 918 brand offers a wide array of classic, traditional, and contemporary window curtain designs. Exquisitely chosen colors, patterns, and fabrications combine with well-crafted construction to create the perfect complement to any décor.

About Lichtenberg Founded in New York City in 1933 by Sam Lichtenberg, Lichtenberg is a fourth generation family owned and operated business. We are personally committed to the quality of our products, the success of our partners, and the satisfaction of our end consumers. We supply soft window coverings in the United States, partnering with over 50 major retailers to offer some of the broadest assortment of ready-made soft window curtains in the market.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful curtains, I thought there were two!
reviews.reviewText: I love theses curtains. Very well made but I thought there was two and had to get another pack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I purchsed these curtains because I wanted to update the look of my room without a hefty price tag. They are nice curtains. The material is a waffle type weave and gives a nice texture. They are not completely sheer. I like that they let light shine through while providing some privacy. As with any folded material, I did have to iron them before I hung them because they were wrinkled. The grommets are a brushed bronze color. The seams are nice and finished looking. They were one or two stray strings I had to trim, but nothing excessive. Overall, the are semi sheer panels that hang well. I ordered 6 panels and they were all the same length and quality. I think they look more expensive than what I paid. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a less expensive curtain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good, well made curtains. I have 18 panels, white, and like them very much.
reviews.reviewText: I have a special use for this and it will probably take a lot of words to explain, so please read on... I'll probably say some things you'll care about. I bought 18 panels!I am upgrading a guest room and adding a room divider to give guests a place not so visible when the double doors to the kitchen are opened. I doubt anyone would do that, of course, but guests would worry about it anyway. This room has 3 windows and the room divider is also made of curtains, weighted at the bottom to make them stable and to hold the shape better. I wanted something NOT see through, but that could pass light. I ordered these mainly because they are inexpensive, but also there were many reviews that gave me confidence.Suggestion: Check out YouTube's videos on hanging grommet curtains... they will give you the basics.1. These are extra wide panels and only have 6 grommets. To look as good as they can look, you'll need a curtain rod that can be adjusted far out from the wall. I had to modify my mounting of the rods to give them enough distance out from the window, etc. to hang properly. If you don't understand what I mean, please ask a question in the comments below and I'll answer.2. They do allow light passage, but NOT vision. I held it up to the window to check that and I can see nothing through it. Some reviews said they are thin, well that's not correct. They may be light weight and they do not have linings or sprayed foam on the back, but you definitely can't see through. This was particularly important where my room divider goes right next to a glass-walled shower. If I had see-through curtains, It would not hide anyone taking a shower, right? I'm concerned enough to carefully scrutinize these curtains.3. They are well stitched and washable. Children stay in that room sometimes and grubby fingers will find a way of touching anything white. I'll report on washability as an update later.4. See through is not a problem on the windows because there are Venitian blinds, but I do want light passage with the blinds open. The thickness of this panel is not too thin or too thick, but just right for that requirement.5. The situation requires the curtains to allow air to circulate, the heat or A/C to control the temperature and a little air movement to keep it from becoming too stale smelling during periods of vacancy.6. These curtains definitely need a good careful ironing to look good. They are heavily creased from folding and the nice zipper bags they each come in. If you don't know how to iron, get someone to help you that does know. Most of the photos here show that they didn't bother to iron. Fine if that's what you want.7. After buying 18, there IS some variation in lengths. This could be an issue if you only order two and find them drastically different. I was able with the large number to be able to match up lengths without trouble. You can also strategically hide a mismatch behind furniture in some cases if you can't work it out otherwise. I don't know if this is also a problem with higher priced curtains. There is certainly no way the retailer could check the exact matched length without taking them out of the packaging and then trying to fold them back exactly the same way, which was kind of complicated. No problem for me though because I just put the shorter curtains on one window and made sure the 11 that went onto the room divider were all perfectly matched.8. I weighted the bottom hems of the curtains on the room divider to keep them hanging nicely. I used 1oz fishing weights on each of the outward folds to do this and it works nicely to help space out the folds.Last comments: Plan out how your curtains will look open or closed, because you can't move a grommeted eyelet past the braces on your curtain rod. If you will only open the center, there's not a problem but if you want to open it wide and there are support hooks in the way, you'll need to get a ladder and lift the rod to do that... not cool. I'm talking about extra wide windows, of course.Adios and good luck!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The following comes from my review of this company’s matching yellow valance curtains that I bought at the same time and generally applies to these full curtains as well:(1) some reviewers commented that they received valance curtains of differing lengths. We bought four of these and when laid right next to each other on a table, they were not exact matched to each other, but the difference is not noticeable when they are hung. If this is typical, then it shouldn’t be a problem, but most manufacturing yields some variance. If that were the case, I’d exchange them at least once before returning. Based on our experience, I’d say these are worth the small gamble.(2) The one thing I really wish were different is the fact that these valance curtains use a silver fitting for the curtain rod wholes — yet, the matching yellow (long) curtain that they sell uses brass colored fittings. Thus, they don’t match. FYI, if you’re buying both.Also, the fitting wholes are 5/8” on the valance, whereas the fitting wholes on the full curtain are 1”. So, don’t get all 1” rods thinking you can use the same exact rods for both (unless you go with all 5/8”).(3) The fabric of the valances and full curtain was the exact same and same color yellow. Perfect!(4) As shown in some photos, but not all, the top and bottom of the valance doubles up the fabric. As a result, the valances are an orange-yellow on the top and bottom and yellow in between. The photos I saw didn’t all show this consistently, so I wasn’t sure. Now I know. That’s what it tis.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Quality control not great - but wasn't expecting too much for this price
reviews.reviewText: The grommets seem good, the fabric is okay - it's unlined and not super thick - but not super thin either.I ordered 6 charcoal gray panels and the color was uniform / same dye lot for all so I was pleased about that.The reason I was a not-so-happy-camper is the fact that the panels were all varying lengths - with the largest variation being one full inch.I had already steamed them and put the on the rod before I noticed how badly two of them were off. Plus I was in a bit of time-crunch. So I wound up paying a local alterations shop to hem them for me and she charged me $10 per pair to hem them all the same length - so they all matched the shortest one. (And I first she was trying to charge me $10 per panel. When refused and told her what I paid for each panel, she relented and lowered the alteration price) I was beyond annoyed.So I still urge folks to buy them - don't wait to until the last minute like me - and perhaps be prepared to buy a few more than you need so that you can get the enough panels with the same hem length.
Super padre ya que entraba la luz y no dejaba ver la tele y que perfecto

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent price. Stunning colour. Will be buying more!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased these for livingroom, Kitchen window (paper blind behind), and patio doors. The cool thing is the colour! It changes depending on the light (see photos, 2nd and last are same curtains with different lighting). They are 100% polyester. It's a waffle type pattern, you don't really see it, but gives them a good weight. No back panel so not "room darkening". Bit wrinkled because I really wanted to test the colour. My only regret... not buying more!! I failed to realize how wide the livingroom window and patio doors are. But at this price, 4 more are on my next order!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Se ve bien y parece que la tela es resistente.
reviews.reviewText: Se ve bien y parece que la tela es resistente.

** NOTE BUY TWO. IT ONLY COMES WITH ONE PANEL**.. although they do state this it can be an easy miss. I had to order twice in order to have both panels.Somewhat sheer but actually in a good way in my opinion. Light comes in nicely without blinding you and it makes the room appear much brighter and nice with the curtains.Slight wrinkling but I honestly only noticed when doing the review and having to star the "wrinkle-free" rating. Really elegant for the price you pay.
Me gustó porque si fue la medida correcta
